comment.author: 29056926@N02
comment._content: Any guess at a date on this lantern slide? The Crater Lake Foundation has a photo of Harp Rock from the 1920s, not alot in common!

comment.author: 34586311@N05
comment._content: Hi Rob Ketcherside, Thanks for asking. In searching for the answer to your question, we actually found quite a deal of new information about some of these slides. A number of these images were created by Fred H. Kiser, a prominent photographer of the time. The Crater Lake Lodge, which was included in the same set of images as this Harp Rock image, opened in 1915, meaning that the image was not created any earlier than this. Further, we do know that the majority of the lectures that accompany the Visual Instruction Slide series were written in 1920, which gives us an end date. Although we can’t be 100% sure, this particular photograph may be part of a series of “nature scene” photographs that Kiser created in 1917. Since this is probably much more information than you were looking, to sum it all up, Fred H. Kiser took this photograph between 1915 and 1920. For more information and further clarification, take a look at our blog. Thanks, Doug
